title: Details not refreshed when issues are edited
description: When an issue is edited it doesn't immediately show the new issue details in the detail panel, and occasionally when issues are updated only a portion of the description is persisted.

title: Change default git email to homespun-bot@homespun.com
description: Change the default email address for git to homespun-bot@localhost.com to avoid sign in issues with Claude Code UI - it validates email addresses for sign ins.

title: Agents page currently broken
description: The agents page currently doesn't work, showing an issue with the real-time updates not working. This appears to be due to a link across the tailscale network.

title: Automate rebasing
description:
Add a button to rebase any open worktrees onto main to the worktrees page. This button should start a new agent that pulls the most recent main branch and rebases onto that. The agents should fix any merge conflicts, review recently merged PRs descriptions and run all tests to ensure no regressions after rebasing.

Add a special rebase agent prompts to the agent management page that can be started on a worktree.

title: Sort the orphaned issues by group
description: Orphaned issues should be sorted by group. They are currently just shown in one branch, but they should be split into one branch per group.

title: Fix Beads setup for new repositories
description: When a new repository is cloned in, the bd init command seems to cause a failure on windows due to LF characters being added to the .beads/ files.

title: Fix starting agents on PRs and InProgress issues
Adjust new issue UI
description:
On mobile the UI for creating a new task renders incorrectly. The type and group should be on the top row and the title expanded with the accept buttons on the far right. Group should default to starting with a lower case characters.

Also allow the user to select between some different "open" statuses, namely "idea", "spec" and "next".

title: Create scripts for running dev and prod containers
Fix model display for new agent selection
description: The model selection UI that is in the IssueDetailPanel above the selection of an agent shows a dot-point list of the different models below a box with the current selected model. This should instead just be a normal drop-down box. Please change it to just be a drop-down box with three options: "Opus", "Sonnet" and "Haiku". Change the default to "Opus".

title: Placeholders for past PRs
description: Past PRs don't show up at all until they pop in and move all of the current items. Please update this such that there are placeholders for 5 PRs that are the same size as the PRs will be when they are loaded.

title: Show agent status
description: The agent status (working or waiting) is information that should be available. This should be displayed on the timeline next to the issues that the agents are linked to. This can just be as text for now. Ideally it should update as the status changes. Please consider how this would best be done using Blazor Interactive Rendering.

title: Allow agents to be resumed
description:
I would like to be able to resume agent sessions. Use the Claude Agent SDK to find all previous sessions related to worktree folders when an issue or PR is selected. Then, show these sessions in a list. When clicked this should open a new session window with the previous chat in it and allow the user to continue the session.

Use a TDD approach.

title: Simplify new issue creation
description: Simplify the creation of new beads issues: issues should be created with just an optional group, type and a required title. Move creation to a box at the bottom of the main project page.

title: Create Settings page with GitHub/git authentication health display
description: Create a Settings page accessible from the sidebar that displays GitHub CLI authentication status, Git credential helper status, Masked GITHUB_TOKEN display, Configuration instructions, and Refresh/re-authenticate button.

title: Run bd sync on cloned repositories
Object reference issue when editing status
description: When running a command like  leece edit gsVYAO --status complete the issue is updated but an 'Error: Object reference not set to an instance of an object' is also returned

title: Show command
description: Create a new  leece show <ID> command that shows all of the details related to an issue.

title: Allow differentpermissions setting in session chat window
description: Currently there are no settings to change the permissions provided to Claude when a message is sent. There should be a dropdown box allowing a user to select between 'Bypass permissions', 'Accept edits', 'Plan' and 'Default'.

title: Improve tool output
description: Currently the tool UI output just shows raw JSON. Different tools should instead display correctly. Review the Claude Agent SDK documentation for the JSON schema of tool responses and show only a brief summary that can be expanded to show a more detailed response. For now, the Explore, Read and Write tools are the most common but male this generally extendable to all tools. You may run some tools as a test to understand the JSON output

title: Render Markdown descriptions
description:
The chat window and issue description should both render text to Markdown by default as this often used by agents in communication and for describing PRs.

This should be possible by just parsing the string using Markdig and emitting HTML strings if valid Markdown is found. If not, fall back to just plain text.

title: Worktree display and refresh
description:
The main project window should be split in two - one side showing the current timeline (on the left) and one side showing the current worktrees and local branches (determined through the Git service). Now that issues are kept within the code the actual issue timeline may be different between different branches. Selecting the worktrees on the right should show the different timelines (for the issues, the PRs will remain the same between branches as these are branch-independent) in the timeline window.

There should also be a refresh button that pulls all of the latest changes for all local branches, and a delete button to delete a local branch and worktree from the project (and from disk).

title: Stop agent completions from redirecting browser
description: When agents complete their work they will redirect the page to the session window. Please stop this behaviour and add an agent status window showing the number of working and waiting agents in the top bar of the application. When clicked, this should redirect to the agent sessions page.

title: Create and edit shortcut
description:
Currently hitting the ENTER key in the quick issue creation bar will create a new issue, but the "create and edit" button must be clicked on. Please change this such that SHIFT+ENTER will activate the "create and edit" button and open the edit window.

Add small icons to the buttons to describe this.

title: Edit page additional properties
description:
The edit page should allow editing of all issue properties, including branch ID and group.

Create a new PR when complete.

title: Worktree management page
description:
I would like to add a branch/worktree page for each project at the route /projects/id/branches. This should list all of the currently started worktrees in the project, allowing me to start and stop agents in the worktree, pull recent changes and delete worktrees and branches (both local and remote). It should also show which worktrees have PRs associated with them, and the status of the worktrees. Only branches and worktrees that have been merged should be allowed to be deleted without warning. Otherwise, a warning modal should be shown.

It should also show all remote branches that have not been pulled. I should be able to create new local worktrees from these branches.

This page should behave like a tab in the projects page, allowing me to switch between the issues view and the worktrees view with links at the top of the page, similar to how GitHub works.

Create a new PR when complete.

title: Custom agents
description:
The agents page should be renamed to "sessions", with "agents" then being used for managing custom agents prompts that can be started.

These custom agents prompts for now should just be the build and plan prompts that are currently available. The prompts themselves can be saved in the homespun-data.json file. These are global settings that affects all projects.

Instead of the "start planning" and "start building" button, there should be a drop-down to select between the various agent prompts, and a start button to start the agent. Also add a "none" option to the button, which just starts an agent in a worktree with no prompt at all.

It should be possible to start agents on PRs as well as on issues. This should check whether the PR branch already has a worktree. If not, it should create a new worktree and start the agent. If it does have a worktree, ensure there are no current agents sessions running in that worktree, then pull recent changes to that worktree and start the agent.

Use a TDD approach in development.

title: Fix breadcrumbs
description:
The breadcrumb links at the top of the page often don't work and are in the wrong case. For example, the current text is

Homespun/Projects/issues/12rMan/Edit

When it should be

Homespun/Projects/Homespun/Issues/Fix breadcrumbs/Edit

Please review all breadcrumbs for the pages and put together a plan to fix this. Pull and update from the remote main first and create a new PR to suit once complete. Use TDD.

title: PR and issue linking doesn't work
description: Currently PRs and issues are not being linked together. When a PR is created with a branch matching that of an issue. The issue should have the PR added to it's "linked PRs" property. Issues with linked PRs should not be shown in the UI but the information should instead be shown alongside the PR summary when the PR is clicked. This linking should occur on project refresh when new PRs are synced and downloaded.

title: Consolidate UI
description:
The UI is currently scattered within various individual pages, and some components exist as separate files while others are embedded in pages. This is making it difficult to manage UI quality and consistency.

Please review the current pages and styling and put together a plan for consolidating this as much as possible by extracting reusable components.

Add tailwind to the project and use this as a centralised styling system. A guide to using tailwind with Blazor may be found here: https://github.com/tesar-tech/BlazorAndTailwind?tab=readme-ov-file. Keep the existing styles (colours, fonts, etc.) as much as possible.

title: Upgrade timeline rendering
description:
Create a custom timeline renderer to replace the git-grapj.js renderer. It should be functionally similar, a simple two column grid drawn. Each row should be one Blazor component.

The left column should be the graph itself, drawn as individual SVG. The right column will include the text and any annotations to denote issue, agent and PR status.

Implement a graph layout algorithm that performs a similar function. Keep track of "lanes" that run vertically and perform a DFS of the graph to determine the lane structure. This can be done in two passes, first to calculate the maximum number of lanes (to determine the SVG width) and then to lay out the lanes.

Use simple straight lines with bends to show lane switching.

title: Add Markdown rendering to PR details
Fix new agents starting for PRs
description:
When I click the "Start" to start a new agent for a PR that has an existing worktree and branch, a new agent is not started. See logs below. I believe this may be due to the worktree path not being found - the worktree and folder does exist when I review the flie system, but it is named "issues/feature/improve-tool-output-aLP3LH" rather than "issues/feature/improve-tool-output+aLP3LH", which is the branch name. title: Improve tool output UI
description: Currently the tool UI output just shows raw JSON. Different tools should instead display correctly. Review the Claude Agent SDK documentation for the JSON schema of tool responses.

title: Render Markdown
description: The chat window and issue description should both render text to Markdown by default as this often used by agents in communication.

title: Remove Test Agent from Release build
description: The 'Start Test Agent' button in the project information panel should be hidden using preprocessor directives to only show in Debug builds. This also applies to the "debug signalR events" in the session page.

title: Allow dev and release containers on the same machine
description: It should be possible to run a dev and a release container on the same machine. Dev containers should have the hostname `homespun-dev` and be run using the latest local build. Production containers should use watchtower to pull from the GitHub container registry and have `homespun` as the hostname. They should both be run from the run.sh and run.ps1 scripts. I believe that this is already possible, it just needs to be able to inject the hostname into the Docker configuration.

title: Allow for arbitrary agents to be run on a worktree
description: Currently only 'build' and 'plan' agents can be run with prompts injected in. A general purpose agent should be able to be started on any worktree.

title: Search doesn't work
description: The  leece search tool no longer works, stating Error: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'source').

title: Commit and push changes
description: It should be possible to add --commit and --push flags to the  leece create command to commit and push changes to the issues in the current branch. A  leece commit --push command should also be available to do the same thing.

title: Create REST API for Homespun
description: A REST API should be designed and implemented to allow programmatic access to the underlying functionality of Homespun. This will should simplify agentic access for testing backend functionality on live applications. The methods that are called by the API should be the same methods that are called by the application front end. It should be documented as a Swagger API.

title: Add REST API with Swagger for backend testing
description:
Implement a REST API layer to enable programmatic access and API-level testing of Homespun functionality.

## Architecture
- Keep Blazor components using @inject for direct service access (no change)
- Add thin API controllers that call existing services
- Add Swagger/OpenAPI documentation

## API Endpoints

### Projects
- GET /api/projects - List all projects
- GET /api/projects/{id} - Get project by ID
- POST /api/projects - Create project
- PUT /api/projects/{id} - Update project
- DELETE /api/projects/{id} - Delete project

### Pull Requests
- GET /api/projects/{id}/pull-requests - List PRs for project
- GET /api/pull-requests/{id} - Get PR by ID
- POST /api/pull-requests - Create PR
- PUT /api/pull-requests/{id} - Update PR
- POST /api/projects/{id}/sync - Sync PRs from GitHub

### Git Worktrees
- GET /api/worktrees - List worktrees
- POST /api/worktrees - Create worktree
- DELETE /api/worktrees/{path} - Delete worktree

### Claude Sessions
- GET /api/sessions - List active sessions
- GET /api/sessions/{id} - Get session details
- POST /api/sessions - Start new session
- POST /api/sessions/{id}/messages - Send message to session
- DELETE /api/sessions/{id} - Stop session

### Fleece Issues
- GET /api/projects/{id}/issues - List issues for project
- GET /api/issues/{id} - Get issue by ID
- POST /api/issues - Create issue
- PUT /api/issues/{id} - Update issue

### Notifications
- POST /api/notifications - Send notification (testing)

## Files to Create

| Path | Purpose |
|------|---------|
| Features/Projects/Controllers/ProjectsController.cs | Projects REST API |
| Features/PullRequests/Controllers/PullRequestsController.cs | PRs REST API |
| Features/Git/Controllers/WorktreesController.cs | Worktrees REST API |
| Features/ClaudeCode/Controllers/SessionsController.cs | Sessions REST API |
| Features/Fleece/Controllers/IssuesController.cs | Issues REST API |

## Files to Modify
- Program.cs - Add Swagger, API explorer

## Implementation Steps
1. Add Swagger/OpenAPI to Program.cs
2. Create ProjectsController (simplest, validates pattern)
3. Implement remaining controllers

## Verification
- Navigate to /swagger and test each endpoint
- Confirm Blazor components still work with @inject

title: Add API integration tests
Add bUnit component tests
description:
Add bUnit testing for Blazor components to test rendering and component logic without a browser.

## Overview
bUnit enables testing Blazor components in isolation - fast execution, no browser needed, mocks services and verifies rendering.

## Setup

Add bUnit package to existing test project:
```xml
<PackageReference Include="bunit" Version="1.35.9" />
```

## Test Structure

```
tests/Homespun.Tests/
├── Components/
│   ├── ProjectDetailTests.cs
│   ├── PullRequestTreeTests.cs
│   ├── SessionChatTests.cs
│   └── ...
```

## Test Pattern

```csharp
public class ProjectDetailTests : TestContext
{
    [Test]
    public void ProjectDetail_DisplaysProjectName()
    {
        var mockProjectService = new Mock<ProjectService>();
        mockProjectService.Setup(s => s.GetByIdAsync(It.IsAny<string>()))
            .ReturnsAsync(new Project { Id = "1", Name = "Test Project" });

        Services.AddSingleton(mockProjectService.Object);

        var cut = RenderComponent<ProjectDetail>(parameters =>
            parameters.Add(p => p.Id, "1"));

        cut.WaitForAssertion(() =>
            cut.Find("h1").TextContent.Should().Contain("Test Project"));
    }
}
```

## Components to Test
- ProjectDetail - Project display and actions
- PullRequestTree - PR hierarchy rendering
- SessionChat - Claude session messaging UI
- AgentManagementPanel - Agent status display
- IssueList - Fleece issue display

## Files to Modify
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Homespun.Tests.csproj - Add bUnit package

## Files to Create
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/ProjectDetailTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/PullRequestTreeTests.cs
- tests/Homespun.Tests/Components/SessionChatTests.cs
- (additional component tests as needed)

## Verification
- Run: dotnet test tests/Homespun.Tests
- All bUnit tests should pass

title: Add Playwright E2E tests for critical journeys
Fleece issues sync
description: There should be a button on the project page to synchronise the fleece issues in the default branch. When clicked, this should commit all files in the project's `.fleece/` folder and push them. It should then pull all changes back from main and refresh the graph. Notify the user if there are issues with pulling the changes back from main - if there are, provide an option to the user to stash or discard all changes in the main branch and try pulling again.

title: Complete UI update
description:
There were recently some updates to main from PR #88. This contains some unfinished work as described in the PR description and a markdown file in .plans/

Please complete this work.

title: Remove model page
description: The models page is not required. Remove it and remove it from the side panel.

title: Show PR status in details and timeline
description: A PR should show whether it is ready to merge and if all checks pass, fail or are running in the issue detail. This should be used to drive agent options such as auto rebasing or asking an agent to fix all checks.

title: Create service mocks
description:
Create mocks for all services with fake data sets. The aim is to provide an environment switch for the application that, when enabled, swaps out the live services for the mocks. This will allow a test application to be run that does not persist and affect any production data.

Create a test data store that has in memory persistence to allow adding and deleting data.

Much of this probably already exists in the test libraries. Do not recreate it - migrate it to the main project into a test folder and refactor the tests to use this data.

title: Question tool
description:
The application can't currently ask the user questions - a tool is shown with the JSON output but there is no way for the user to provide input in the expected manner.

The documentation (in Python and Typescript) is here: https://platform.claude.com/docs/en/agent-sdk/user-input#handle-clarifying-questions
Please note, however, that the Claude Agent SDK being used by the application is a C# port - add additional functionality as required to get this to work. You can also ask an example question to understand the format, however do not expect this question to be answered as the user cannot interact with the question.

Being asked a question should put the session in a waiting state, and the user should be able to navigate to the page and answer the questions by clicking on option buttons or typing in alternate answers into the chat. I am happy for this to occur in the chat stream itself, it does not require modification to the input box.

title: Add tabs to top of project page
description: At the top of the project page at the projects/{id} route, the application shows the Issues and Branches pages as links rather than as visually separate tabs (that should appear like tabs but still route to different pages. Please use the Playwright MCP tools with the application run in mock mode to investigate this behaviour and iterate on a fix.

title: Add design routes for component testing
description: A set of /design/{component-name} routes should be added that show all individual components with mock data when the application is run in the `mock` environment. This can then be used by Claude Code and the Playwright MCP tool to iterate on UI design.

title: Branch preview for issues with custom ID not using correct ID
description: When an issue has a custom branch ID, it shows the "Branch Preview" correctly in the "edit" page but doesn't show the branch ID correctly in the issue detail panel, instead choosing to show the automatically generated branch ID instead. Fix this.

title: Install Playwright MCP plugin by default
Running agents on open PRs doesn't create worktree
description: Running agents on open PRs switches the main branch worktree to the PR instead of creating a new worktree. Please investigate and fix this - it should either create a new worktree or if one already exists in that location it should use that folder and pull the most recent changes.

title: Show issue and PR details in the session window
Clicking session indicator in top bar goes to wrong page
description: Clicking on the session indicator navigates to the agents page rather than the session page. Please fix. Also sort the session page to have the waiting sessions at the top and the working sessions at the bottom.

title: Remove project information panel
description: The project information panel is not very useful. Migrate the issue sync button elsewhere and just remove the panel.

title: Playwright doesn't render CSS
description:
When the Playwright MCP tools are run on a site when it is built with dotnet run in a container it doesn't render the CSS properly, likely due to either the Tailwind dependencies not running or some Blazor issues. Could you please run the app, and take a screenshot with Blazor then review the browser and app logs to diagnose and fix this issue?

In previous attempts you appear to have killed the Homespun process, dotnet process or the container that you are running in. Do not kill any containers that you are running on under any circumstances - instead, run a container with a new name using the ./scripts/run.sh command if you are testing something.

title: Improve worktree management
description:
The branch and worktree management system needs some improvement as it blocks agents from starting and has become difficult to manage.

## Branches page

### Active worktrees panel

- This shows "Plan" and "Build" buttons for each of the worktrees. Replace these with the normal agent management control that is used in the issues details. If this is not already a separate Blazor component, extract it to one now.
- Show "lost worktrees", these being the folders that reside beside the main folder but are not associated with the branch. Tag these as being "Lost".
- Add a button to delete the lost worktrees (deleting the worktree folder completely) and to "repair" the worktree by attaching it back to a branch (if a matching branch can be found).
- Add a tag to show any worktrees (including main) that are not checked out against the branch that matches the name of the worktree. Add a button to checkout the correct target branch and to get it back on task.
- Show the current git status (number of files modified) for all worktrees.
- Add a global button to prune all worktrees.
- Show the agent session status against worktrees that have an agent running in them.

### Local branches

- Move the local branches with PRs into a new panel "Open PRs". Only include local branches without PRs in this list.
- It appears that the branches with PRs that were squash merged don't show up as being related to PRs and don't show up as "merged". Update this so that local branches are tracked against PRs that have been merged. 
- Show if branches are local only **and** remote or just local only with a tag showing that it is local only.

### Remote branches

- Show which of these branches have been merged (or squash merged) to main.
- Add a button to delete the remote branch.
- Ensure that when "checkout" is clicked that this also creates a new worktree. Currently when this is clicked it checks out the branch to the root worktree, and then tries to create the worktree. It fails to do this as two worktrees cannot be checked out with the same branch. Instead, it should create the worktree first and leave the default branch alone.

Implement this using a TDD approach.

title: Fix issues with worktree and branch naming
description:
When a new worktree is created for an issue, it currently creates the new worktree with a default automatically generated branch name. It appears that this is being persisted independent to the {group}/{type}/{branch-id} pattern, so when these details are changed for an issue they are not recalculated and updated prior to creating the branch and worktree.

Create an integration test to confirm that this does occur, then fix it - the branch name and worktree folder name should always match and should always be recalculated just before creating the branch and worktree.

Use the Playwright MCP and a mock build of the website to confirm this issue as well. The mock issue and branch data may need to be extended to show this behaviour.

This appears to be related to the issue X4LlBY - the issue that is displayed in the

title: Restarting agents on existing worktrees doesn't work
description:
If a session has previously been running on a worktree after having been started on an issue, when I try to start a new agent session on that worktree it fails as it tries to first create the worktree.

Always check whether the worktree exists first and just start the agent in that worktree if it does. This seems to work OK when I start a new agent in a worktree in the "branches" page - the logic should be similar for starting a new agent on an issue if the worktree already exists.

title: Tool view changes aren't implemented
description: When a session is being run it still shows the raw tool output as JSON. I was under the understanding that this was largely fixed in PR #84. Please review the PR and the current status of the application, using `./scripts/mock.sh` to run the application and the Playwright MCP tools to navigate the page. Do not kill any processes or containers to run the application. You may need to add additional test data to show the tool behaviour. Create a plan to fix this.

title: Deleting worktrees and branches doesn't check whether remotes exist
description: When deleting a worktree it seems to be assumed that a remote branch exists. When I select the 'delete remote as well' option, it throws an exception as the remote branch doesn't exist. Check whether this exists prior to attempting to delete the remote.

title: Change mock scripts to run containers
description:
Change the scripts/mock.sh and scripts/mock.ps1 to build and run the application in a container with mock data instead of running the application directly. The application should be able to specify a port to expose the container to so that it can connect to it with the MCP tools.

You may need to modify the scripts/run.sh and scripts/run.ps1 scripts to allow the build to be changed to use mock data instead.

Update the Dockerfile to include the necessary dependencies for the container to run the application as a container. Use DooD unless there is an obvious reason to use DinD.

Try to test this, but if it requires rebuilding the host container that you are currently running in let me know and I can test it then.

title: Fix session crashes
description:
# Bug Investigation: Playwright MCP Serialization Error Causing Container Crashes

## Summary

The Playwright MCP tools are returning malformed responses that contain .NET type names instead of properly serialized JSON data. This bug appears to be causing container crashes/restarts, with processes being terminated by signals (exit codes 128, 144).

## Evidence

### 1. Malformed Playwright Responses

Instead of returning actual content, Playwright MCP tools return:
```
System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[System.String,System.Object]]
```

This occurs across multiple Playwright tools:
- `mcp__playwright__browser_navigate`
- `mcp__playwright__browser_snapshot`
- `mcp__playwright__browser_click`
- `mcp__playwright__browser_take_screenshot`
- `mcp__playwright__browser_press_key`
- `mcp__playwright__browser_close`

### 2. Affected Sessions

Analysis of 11 session logs shows:
- **72+ instances** of this serialization error across 9 session files
- Sessions with Playwright usage have higher rates of abnormal termination
- Sessions end abruptly (USER message as last entry) when Playwright is heavily used

### 3. Exit Codes Indicating Signal Termination

| Exit Code | Meaning | Occurrences |
|-----------|---------|-------------|
| 128 | Process killed by signal | 24 |
| 144 | Signal 16 (SIGUSR1) | 4 |

Exit codes ≥128 indicate the process was terminated by a signal, not a normal exit. This suggests the container runtime (Docker) killed the process, likely due to resource exhaustion.

### 4. Connection Errors Following Playwright Usage

Multiple sessions show `ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED` errors after Playwright tool calls, indicating the server became unavailable mid-session.

## Your Task

1. **Locate the Playwright MCP implementation** - Find where the MCP server handles Playwright tool responses

2. **Identify the serialization bug** - The code is likely calling `.ToString()` on a `List<Dictionary<string, object>>` instead of properly serializing it to JSON. Look for:
   - Response handling code for Playwright tools
   - JSON serialization of tool results
   - Any place where `List<>` or `Dictionary<>` types are converted to strings

3. **Check for resource leaks** - The repeated malformed responses may indicate:
   - Browser instances not being properly disposed
   - Memory leaks from screenshot/snapshot operations
   - Unclosed connections or streams

4. **Fix the serialization** - Ensure all Playwright tool responses are properly serialized using `System.Text.Json.JsonSerializer.Serialize()` or equivalent, not `.ToString()`

5. **Add error handling** - Ensure Playwright errors don't crash the MCP server:
   - Wrap browser operations in try-catch
   - Properly dispose resources on error
   - Return structured error responses instead of crashing

## Expected vs Actual Behavior

**Expected:** Playwright tools return JSON-serialized content:
```json
{
  "content": [{"type": "text", "text": "Navigation successful"}],
  "isError": false
}
```

**Actual:** Tools return .NET type name as a string:
```
System.Collections.Generic.List`1[System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2[System.String,System.Object]]
```

## Files to Investigate

Look for files related to:
- MCP server implementation
- Playwright tool handlers
- Tool response serialization
- Any `IToolHandler` or similar interface implementations

Search patterns:
```bash
# Find Playwright-related MCP code
rg -l "playwright" --type cs
rg -l "mcp.*tool|tool.*handler" --type cs -i

# Find serialization code
rg "List<Dictionary<string" --type cs
rg "ToString\(\)" --type cs -A2 -B2 | grep -i "result\|response\|content"

# Find MCP response building
rg "ToolResult|McpResponse|CallToolResult" --type cs
```

## Reproduction Steps

1. Start a session with Playwright MCP tools enabled
2. Use any Playwright tool (navigate, click, snapshot, etc.)
3. Observe the tool response - it should show the .NET type name instead of actual content
4. After several Playwright operations, the container may crash or become unresponsive

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Playwright tools return properly serialized JSON responses
- [ ] No .NET type names appear in tool output
- [ ] Sessions with heavy Playwright usage complete without abnormal termination
- [ ] Exit codes remain 0 (normal) rather than 128+ (signal-terminated)
- [ ] No `ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED` errors after Playwright operations

## Additional Context

This bug only started occurring after Playwright MCP tools were introduced. Sessions without Playwright usage do not exhibit the crash behavior. The correlation between Playwright usage and container crashes is strong across all analyzed session logs.

title: Replace ACA session pools with NFS-mounted worker container apps
description:
## Problem

Azure Container Apps session pools do not support volume mounts (confirmed in the 2025-07-01 API). This prevents agent worker containers from sharing a filesystem with the main application container. Currently:

- The Azure Files SMB mount does not support chmod, breaking both Tailscale state and git clone operations
- Agent workers cannot access cloned repositories on the shared filesystem
- Each worker must clone repos independently, duplicating data and bandwidth

The goal is for the main app and all agent containers to mount the same NFS file share and treat repositories as a local filesystem. Agents work in their own git worktrees, minimising file operation conflicts.

## Solution

Replace ACA session pools with regular container apps for agent workers, backed by Azure Files NFS which supports full POSIX permissions. The worker already manages multiple sessions via HTTP API internally (WorkerSessionService), so a single worker container app can handle concurrent sessions without per-session container isolation.

## Work Breakdown

### Phase 1: Infrastructure - VNet + NFS Storage

The ACA environment requires VNet integration at creation time (cannot be added post-creation), and NFS requires the storage account to be accessible from within that VNet.

1. **Add VNet and subnets to Bicep** - Create a new `network.bicep` module:
   - VNet with address space (e.g., 10.0.0.0/16)
   - ACA infrastructure subnet (e.g., 10.0.0.0/23 - ACA requires minimum /23)
   - Storage private endpoint subnet (e.g., 10.0.2.0/24)

2. **Update environment module** (`modules/environment.bicep`):
   - Add `vnetConfiguration` with infrastructure subnet ID
   - Set `internal: true` for internal-only environment (Tailscale handles external access)

3. **Switch storage to NFS** (`modules/storage.bicep`):
   - Change `enabledProtocols` from `'SMB'` to `'NFS'`
   - Set `supportsHttpsTrafficOnly: false` (NFS requires this)
   - Keep `Premium_LRS` / `FileStorage` (already correct tier)

4. **Add private endpoint for storage** - New `storage-endpoint.bicep` module:
   - Create private endpoint for the storage account on the storage subnet
   - Create private DNS zone for `privatelink.file.core.windows.net`
   - Link DNS zone to VNet

5. **Update environment storage mount** (`modules/environment.bicep`):
   - Change from `azureFile` (SMB with account key) to `nfsAzureFile` (NFS, no key needed)
   - NFS uses network-based auth, so `storageAccountKey` parameter can be removed

### Phase 2: Infrastructure - Worker Container App

Replace the session pool module with a regular container app for workers.

6. **Create worker container app module** (`modules/worker-containerapp.bicep`):
   - Regular `Microsoft.App/containerApps` resource (like main app)
   - Mount the same NFS volume from the environment storage
   - Volume mount path: `/data` (same as main app, shared filesystem)
   - Environment variables: GitHub token, Claude OAuth (from Key Vault secrets)
   - Ingress: internal only (only accessible within the ACA environment)
   - Target port: 8080 (worker HTTP API)
   - Scaling: min 1, max based on `maxConcurrentSessions` parameter
   - HTTP scaling rule based on concurrent requests
   - Include `revisionSuffix` with deployment timestamp (same pattern as main app)

7. **Update main.bicep**:
   - Add network module deployment
   - Pass VNet/subnet IDs to environment module
   - Replace session pool module with worker container app module
   - Pass worker container app FQDN as output
   - Remove session pool outputs, add worker app outputs

### Phase 3: Application - Agent Execution Service

The worker already handles multiple sessions via its HTTP API (POST /api/sessions, /api/sessions/{id}/message, etc). The main change is how the main app connects to the worker.

8. **Create new execution service** or update `AzureContainerAppsAgentExecutionService`:
   - Remove all Azure Management API calls for session pool management (no more creating/deleting pool sessions via PUT/DELETE to the sessions API)
   - Configure worker endpoint as a simple base URL (worker container app's internal FQDN)
   - Route all HTTP/SSE calls directly to the worker container app
   - Session lifecycle: worker manages sessions internally (already implemented in WorkerSessionService)
   - StartSession: POST to `http://{worker-fqdn}/api/sessions`
   - SendMessage: POST to `http://{worker-fqdn}/api/sessions/{id}/message`
   - StopSession: DELETE to `http://{worker-fqdn}/api/sessions/{id}`
   - Health check: GET `http://{worker-fqdn}/api/health`

9. **Update configuration** (`AgentExecutionOptions.cs` and `appsettings.json`):
   - Add `WorkerEndpoint` setting (internal FQDN of worker container app)
   - Remove session pool specific settings (SubscriptionId, ResourceGroup, SessionPoolName)
   - Or keep the existing ACA mode and add a new property for the worker endpoint

10. **Update worker to use shared filesystem**:
    - Configure ClaudeAgentSdk working directory to use the NFS-mounted path (e.g., `/data/src/{project}/{worktree}`)
    - Worker already runs in the same filesystem context as main app
    - Verify git operations work on NFS mount (chmod support)

### Phase 4: Cleanup and Testing

11. **Remove session pool resources**:
    - Delete `modules/sessionpool.bicep`
    - Remove session pool references from `main.bicep`
    - Clean up unused parameters

12. **Update deploy script** (`scripts/deploy.ps1`):
    - Update outputs displayed after deployment
    - Add worker container app URL to outputs

13. **Update start.sh**:
    - Revert Tailscale state to `/data/tailscale` (NFS supports chmod)
    - Or keep on local filesystem if persistence isn't needed

14. **Testing**:
    - Deploy to dev environment
    - Verify NFS mount works (chmod, git clone, git worktree)
    - Verify Tailscale connects
    - Start an agent session and confirm it can read/write to shared filesystem
    - Verify concurrent sessions work correctly
    - Test agent worktree isolation

## Key Decisions

- **Single worker container app** vs per-session containers: Single app is simpler, the worker already handles multi-session. Agents are isolated via git worktrees, not containers.
- **ACA environment recreation**: VNet integration requires recreating the environment. This will cause downtime. Plan for a maintenance window.
- **Internal ingress only**: Both main app and worker use internal ingress. Tailscale provides external access to the main app. Workers are only accessible within the environment.
